articles.title: Europe's drought exposes ancient stones, World War Two ships as waters recede - The Globe and Mail
articles.description: Weeks of drought across Europe have exposed long-submerged treasures and some unwanted hazards
articles.content: The Dolmen of Guadalperal, also known as the Spanish Stonehenge, is seen due to the receding waters of the Valdecanas reservoir in the outskirts of El Gordo, Spain on Aug. 3, 2022.SUSANA VERA/Reuters… [+2538 chars]

articles.title: The sun is going to DIE... but don't worry it won't happen for another 5 billion years, ESA predicts - Daily Mail
articles.description: The European Space Agency has predicted the future of our sun - it will will start on a path of destruction in at least 5 billion years when it reaches its maximum temperature.
